General ramblings of socal supermoto

Leatt Coolit Vest under Leathers Review

To cut to the chase, does it work? Yep. Read on for more details.

I tested the leatt coolit vest two days this week at Adams motorsports park in Riverside, 15 min riding sessions in 97 degree heat wearing a 1pc vanson supermoto suit. Even though the vanson vents well, at near 100 degrees you need all the help you can get in the cooling dept.

You ever see jet lag pills? They work like this: The directions say to take a pill with 8oz of water every half hour. So they work, you won’t feel jet lagged, mostly because you just drank 8 oz of water every half hour over your 14hr flight. The leatt absolutely works, but I was worried the only real reason it works is because it puts you into the routine of regularly soaking it in ice water then putting it on and off. So I put that exact question to the test.

Vest worn over underarmor: I put on my underarmor shirt, then the vest that was soaked in ice water, and stood around with my leathers on for 10 min, then rode a 15 min session. It did it’s job, It kept me pretty comfortable during the session, but the big advantage is the awesome job cooling your core right at the begining. So it works amazing if you are willing to take it on and off and resoak it every half hour. Instead I preferred to wear my long sleeve under amor first, give the vest a good ice soaking in the morning, then every few sessions with the vest still on pour icy water under the vest. Almost as effective as resoaking, and it was lot easier than taking it on and off. This way you could basically just wear it all day, and just occasionally dump some water on yourself.

Vest worn agaist chest, no underarmor: It may have cooled moderately better, but it was so tough to pull my sweaty arms out of my leathers after the session that it’s not worth it. For MX might be different but for sportbike trackdays and supermoto I’d keep using your underarmor in conjunction with the vest, and again just pour ice water down between sessions.

Icy wet tshirt: To compare how much the cooling was a result of the leatt coolit vest, and how much was the result of just dipping it over and over again in ice water, I did the same routine with a tshirt. I used a american apparel socal supermoto t, which besides its awesome cooling powers, is good for 3-4hp. It worked for a session. I didn’t get steamed to death which was the theory of my riding mates. But frankly the wet tshirt feels super creepy after 15min.

Once out of the leathers, when I was out on the track taking photos of riders, I preferred to take the vest off and just use the underarmor, even with the heat. feels a little heavy and weird, however I never noticed that when geared up. it loosens it up with water, so buy it tight. I wear a xl jacket, large tshirt, and the medium vest fits perfect.

Summary: It works, but requires either resoaking it every half hour, or the cheater soak which is refreshing the cool by pouring water down between the vest and underarmor shirt. I’ll have it in my gear bag, and since I bring a cooler anyway, I’ll absolutely use this on a scorcher day.

July 19, 2012 | No Comments »
